TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit WindowsSecurityToken extends System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityToken

Docs.summary: Represents a security token that is based on the identity of a Windows domain or user account.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Typically, application developers do not need to use the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.WindowsSecurityToken> class, unless a Web service must gain access to details about the Windows domain or user account associated with the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.WindowsSecurityToken> security token. To get the details of the Windows domain or user account, access the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.WindowsSecurityToken.WindowsIdentity%2A> property.

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using the Windows user.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This constructor creates a unique identifier for the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.WindowsSecurityToken> security token and assigns that value to the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.WindowsSecurityToken.Id%2A> property.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Dispose() cil managed

Docs.summary: Releases all resources used by the .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Call the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.WindowsSecurityToken.Dispose%2A> method when you are finished using the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.WindowsSecurityToken>. The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.WindowsSecurityToken.Dispose%2A> method leaves the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.WindowsSecurityToken> in an unusable state. After calling the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.WindowsSecurityToken.Dispose%2A> method, you must release all references to the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.WindowsSecurityToken> so the garbage collector can reclaim the memory that the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.WindowsSecurityToken> was occupying.
> [!NOTE] > Always call the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.WindowsSecurityToken.Dispose%2A> method before you release your last reference to the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.WindowsSecurityToken>. Otherwise, the resources it is using will not be freed until the garbage collector calls the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.WindowsSecurityToken> object's `Finalize` method.

Docs.summary: Gets the unique identifier for the security token.
Docs.value: A unique identifier for the security token.

Docs.param: A unique identifier for the security token. Sets the value of the property.
A that represents the instant in time at which this security token is first valid. Set the value of the property.
A that represents the last instant in time at which this security token is valid. Sets the value of the property.
A that represents a Windows user. Sets the value of the property.
to create a object that is identical to the windowsIdentity parameter and assign that to the property; otherwise, assign the value of the windowsIdentity parameter to the property.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using the specified unique identifier, Windows user, and the first and last instants in time when the security token is valid.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.WindowsSecurityToken.Initialize%2A> method is called by the constructors for the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.WindowsSecurityToken> class.

to create a object that is identical to the windowsIdentity parameter and assign that to the WindowsIdentity property; otherwise, assign the value of the windowsIdentity parameter to the WindowsIdentity property.

Gets the cryptographic keys associated with the security token.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.WindowsSecurityToken.SecurityKeys%2A> method returns an empty collection, by default.

Docs.exception: the method has been called for this instance.

Docs.summary: Gets the first instant in time at which this security token is valid.
Docs.value: A that represents the instant in time at which this security token is first valid.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.WindowsSecurityToken.ValidFrom%2A> property is set to the instant in time when the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.WindowsSecurityToken> class is created.

Docs.summary: Gets the last instant in time at which this security token is valid.
Docs.value: A that represents the last instant in time at which this security token is valid.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.WindowsSecurityToken> security token is valid for 10 hours, by default. The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.WindowsSecurityToken.ValidTo%2A> property is set to the instant in time when the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.WindowsSecurityToken> class is created plus 10 hours.

Docs.summary: Gets the Windows user associated with this security token.
Docs.value: A that represents a Windows user.
